data.name: CmdSettingsDescription
data.value: The settings file to use when running tests.

data.name: CmdListTestsDescription
data.value: List the discovered tests instead of running the tests.

data.name: CmdTestCaseFilterDescription
data.value: Run tests that match the given expression. Examples: Run tests with priority set to 1: --filter "Priority = 1" Run a test with the specified full name: --filter "FullyQualifiedName=Namespace.ClassName.MethodName" Run tests that contain the specified name: --filter "FullyQualifiedName~Namespace.Class" See https://aka.ms/vstest-filtering for more information on filtering support.

data.name: CmdTestAdapterPathDescription
data.value: The path to the custom adapters to use for the test run.

data.name: CmdLoggerDescription
data.value: The logger to use for test results. Examples: Log in trx format using a unique file name: --logger trx Log in trx format using the specified file name: --logger "trx;LogFileName=<TestResults.trx>" See https://aka.ms/vstest-report for more information on logger arguments.

data.name: CmdOutputDescription
data.value: The output directory to place built artifacts in.

data.name: CmdPathTologFileDescription
data.value: Enable verbose logging to the specified file.

data.name: CmdNoBuildDescription
data.value: Do not build the project before testing. Implies --no-restore.

data.name: CmdNoRestoreDescription
data.value: Do not execute an implicit restore.

data.name: CmdArchitectureDescription
data.value: The target architecture '{0}' on which tests will run.

data.name: CmdConfigurationDescription
data.value: Defines the build configuration. The default for most projects is Debug, but you can override the build configuration settings in your project.

data.name: CmdProjectDescription
data.value: Defines the path of the project file to run (folder name or full path). If not specified, it defaults to the current directory.

data.name: CmdSolutionDescription
data.value: Defines the path of the solution file to run. If not specified, it defaults to the current directory.

data.name: CmdDirectoryDescription
data.value: Defines the path of directory to run. If not specified, it defaults to the current directory.

data.name: CmdResultsDirectoryDescription
data.value: The directory where the test results will be placed. The specified directory will be created if it does not exist.

data.name: RunSettingsArgumentsDescription
data.value: RunSettings arguments: Arguments to pass as RunSettings configurations. Arguments are specified as '[name]=[value]' pairs after "-- " (note the space after --). Use a space to separate multiple '[name]=[value]' pairs. See https://aka.ms/vstest-runsettings-arguments for more information on RunSettings arguments. Example: dotnet test -- MSTest.DeploymentEnabled=false MSTest.MapInconclusiveToFailed=True

data.name: cmdCollectDescription
data.value: The friendly name of the data collector to use for the test run. More info here: https://aka.ms/vstest-collect

data.name: CmdBlameDescription
data.value:
Runs the tests in blame mode. This option is helpful in isolating problematic tests that cause the test host to crash or hang, but it does not create a memory dump by default.
When a crash is detected, it creates an sequence file in TestResults/guid/guid_Sequence.xml that captures the order of tests that were run before the crash.
Based on the additional settings, hang dump or crash dump can also be collected.
Example: Timeout the test run when test takes more than the default timeout of 1 hour, and collect crash dump when the test host exits unexpectedly. (Crash dumps require additional setup, see below.) dotnet test --blame-hang --blame-crash Example: Timeout the test run when a test takes more than 20 minutes and collect hang dump. dotnet test --blame-hang-timeout 20min

data.name: FrameworkOptionDescription
data.value: The target framework to run tests for. The target framework must also be specified in the project file.

data.name: RuntimeOptionDescription
data.value: The target runtime to test for.

data.name: ConfigurationOptionDescription
data.value: The configuration to use for running tests. The default for most projects is 'Debug'.

data.name: CmdNoLogo
data.value: Run test(s), without displaying Microsoft Testplatform banner

data.name: IgnoredArgumentsMessage
data.value: The following arguments have been ignored : "{0}"

data.name: CmdBlameCrashCollectAlwaysDescription
data.value: Enables collecting crash dump on expected as well as unexpected testhost exit.

data.name: CmdBlameCrashDescription
data.value:
Runs the tests in blame mode and collects a crash dump when the test host exits unexpectedly. This option depends on the version of .NET used, the type of error, and the operating system.
For exceptions in managed code, a dump will be automatically collected on .NET 5.0 and later versions. It will generate a dump for testhost or any child process that also ran on .NET 5.0 and crashed. Crashes in native code will not generate a dump. This option works on Windows, macOS, and Linux.
Crash dumps in native code, or when targetting .NET Framework, or .NET Core 3.1 and earlier versions, can only be collected on Windows, by using Procdump. A directory that contains procdump.exe and procdump64.exe must be in the PATH or PROCDUMP_PATH environment variable.
The tools can be downloaded here: https://docs.microsoft.com/sysinternals/downloads/procdump
To collect a crash dump from a native application running on .NET 5.0 or later, the usage of Procdump can be forced by setting the VSTEST_DUMP_FORCEPROCDUMP environment variable to 1.
Implies --blame.

data.name: CmdBlameCrashDumpTypeDescription
data.value: The type of crash dump to be collected. Supported values are full (default) and mini. Implies --blame-crash.

data.name: CmdBlameHangDescription
data.value: Run the tests in blame mode and enables collecting hang dump when test exceeds the given timeout. Implies --blame-hang.

data.name: CmdBlameHangDumpTypeDescription
data.value: The type of crash dump to be collected. The supported values are full (default), mini, and none. When 'none' is used then test host is terminated on timeout, but no dump is collected. Implies --blame-hang.

data.name: CmdBlameHangTimeoutDescription
data.value: Per-test timeout, after which hang dump is triggered and the testhost process is terminated. Default is 1h. The timeout value is specified in the following format: 1.5h / 90m / 5400s / 5400000ms. When no unit is used (e.g. 5400000), the value is assumed to be in milliseconds. When used together with data driven tests, the timeout behavior depends on the test adapter used. For xUnit, NUnit and MSTest 2.2.4+ the timeout is renewed after every test case, For MSTest before 2.2.4, the timeout is used for all testcases.

data.name: CmdMaxParallelTestModulesDescription
data.value: The max number of test modules that can run in parallel.

data.name: CmdAdditionalMSBuildParametersDescription
data.value: The additional msbuild parameters to pass.

data.name: CmdTestModulesDescription
data.value: Run tests for the specified test modules.

data.name: CmdTestModulesRootDirectoryDescription
data.value: The test modules have the specified root directory.

data.name: CmdUnsupportedVSTestTestApplicationsDescription
data.value: Test application(s) that support VSTest are not supported.

data.name: ConsoleIsAlreadyInBatchingMode
data.value: Console is already in batching mode.
data.comment: Exception that is thrown when console is already collecting input into a batch (into a string builder), and code asks to enable batching mode again.

data.name: DiscoveredTestsInAssembly
data.comment: 0 is count, the sentence is followed by the path of the assebly

data.name: FromFile
data.comment: from followed by a file name to point to the file from which test is originating

data.name: MinimumExpectedTestsPolicyViolation
data.value: Minimum expected tests policy violation, tests ran {0}, minimum expected {1}

data.name: OutOfProcessArtifactsProduced
data.value: Out of process file artifacts produced:

data.name: StackFrameAt
data.comment: at that is used for a stack frame location in a stack trace, is followed by a class and method name

data.name: StackFrameIn
data.comment: in that is used in stack frame it is followed by file name

data.name: TestDiscoverySummary
data.comment: 0 is number of tests, 1 is count of assemblies

data.name: CmdNonExistentFileErrorDescription
data.value: The provided file path does not exist: {0}.

data.name: CmdNonExistentDirectoryErrorDescription
data.value: The provided directory path does not exist: {0}.

data.name: CmdMultipleProjectOrSolutionFilesErrorDescription
data.value: Specify which project or solution file to use because this folder contains more than one project or solution file.

data.name: CmdNoProjectOrSolutionFileErrorDescription
data.value: Specify a project or solution file. The current working directory does not contain a project or solution file.

data.name: CmdMSBuildProjectsPropertiesErrorDescription
data.value: Get projects properties with MSBuild didn't execute properly with exit code: {0}.

data.name: CmdInvalidSolutionFileExtensionErrorDescription
data.value: The provided solution file has an invalid extension: {0}.

data.name: CmdInvalidProjectFileExtensionErrorDescription
data.value: The provided project file has an invalid extension: {0}.

data.name: CmdMultipleBuildPathOptionsErrorDescription
data.value: Specify either the project, solution or directory option.
